reviews.title: Convenient with friendly staff
reviews.text: of Kim I would have been up for over 24hrs with nowhere to rest,shower

Clean, friendly staff, large rooms. Directly off the highway - a great place to stay if you are visiting Univ. of Alabama. Workout room has treadmills, an elliptical, and a bike. No weights that I was aware of. Free coffee in the morning and they also have "cafe" where they will cook food to order. I had the oatmeal, which came with brown sugar, dried cranberries, and walnuts. Really one of the cleaner and friendlier Courtyards I have been to. I had one issue, called the front desk, and it was immediately resolved - very appreciated. Thank you to your great staff!!

reviews.text: Nothing spectacular, but if are visiting the Univ of Alabama or going to an Alabama game, would recommend - good location to campus, hotel is clean, staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are average - solid Courtyard (better than the old courtyards, but not as nice as a brand new courtyard)
reviews.title: Overpriced for a Marriott Courtyard
An above average stay in Tuscaloosa
reviews.text: A sudden family event required a five night stay in Tuscaloosa, AL. I have stayed in the city previously, but had made the Hampton Inn close to the university my preferred hotel. The Courtyard Marriott had a better rate and as it is just off the interstate, made it easier to go back and forth to the smaller rural town I needed to spend time in. My original booking was for two nights ( Wed& Thurs) in a regular king room, but I was able to extend the reservation into five nights and upgrade to a suite room ( to accommodate wife and kids) in a very easy and efficient way. The rate change , with a AAA discount, went from $119 to $139.

reviews.title: good hotel
reviews.text: The staff is extremely polite ( southern hospitality!) and well trained. The hotel does a made-to-order breakfast in the morning ( about $9 ) and an evening happy hour with hot appetizers and cocktails. ( drinks were about $6 ).

reviews.title: Nice and clean
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel because of the location to local restaurants ( mostly chains), stores, shopping, hospital, the college, etc. Tuscaloosa is an hour from the Birmingham airport. Having a comfortable place to rest and relax during the stressful days there made a tremendous difference and I would certainly stay at the Courtyard again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel using a free night from my Marriot Rewards program. I had a King room with a balcony which was very good to have. No free breakfast but there are plenty of places to pick from nearby. They don't just have fast food close by. There are sit down restaurants as well. There is also a movie theatre very close by. The lobby is very modern and inviting.
reviews.title: Home away from Home..

reviews.text: Surrounding area was just as good and was close to everything but far enough away to not deal with the hustle and bustle of life. The Pool area with Jacuzzi is amazing and closes at 11pm so if you get back late you can still enjoy it.

reviews.title: Absolutely the best hotel we have ever stayed at

reviews.text: Everything about our stay at this hotel was excellent. The room was immaculate. The bed was comfortable. The entire place was, I believe, one of the cleanest hotels we've ever stayed. The staff was friendly and accomdating. I have not one negative thing to say about this Courtyard. There are so many hotels that could follow their example if they wish to improve customer service. Thanks for a great night's stay!

reviews.text: This place is hands down the best hotel weve ever stayed at. Staff is so friendly and helpful. Room was clean and for once the bed was comfortable loke sleeping in my own. reviews.title: Modern style, clean rooms, great service, best value in the area.

description: When your travels bring you to "Home of the Crimson Tide," stay at the Tuscaloosa Courtyard, located off of I-59. Relax and enjoy the comfort of one of our Newly Renovated 78 spacious guest rooms, optimize productivity with our business services or enjoy personal time in our refreshing public space. Situated just 5 miles away, be sure to visit the famous University of Alabama campus and take in a bit of history at the Bear Bryant Museum.
